events.originalText: An earthquake registering 6.2 Mw caused the deaths of at least 1,000 people in Afghanistan and Pakistan.
events.subtitle: June 2022 Afghanistan earthquake
events.headline: 1,000 Dead in Afghanistan and Pakistan Earthquake

events.originalText: Two Metro trains collided in Washington, D.C., killing nine people and injuring eighty others.
events.subtitle: Washington Metro
events.headline: Nine Killed in Washington, D.C. Metro Train Collision

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 6.5 Mw struck northwestern Iran, killing at least 230 people and injuring 1,300 others, and later causing widespread public anger at the slow official response.
events.subtitle: 2002 Bou'in-Zahra earthquake
events.headline: 230 Dead in Iran Earthquake, Slow Response Sparks Anger

events.originalText: Former British Liberal Party leader Jeremy Thorpe was acquitted of conspiracy to murder Norman Scott, who had accused Thorpe of having a relationship with him.
events.subtitle: Liberal Party (UK)
events.headline: Jeremy Thorpe Acquitted of Conspiracy to Murder Norman Scott

events.originalText: Vietnamese Buddhist activist leader Thích Trí Quang was arrested as the military junta of Nguyễn Cao Kỳ crushed the Buddhist Uprising.
events.subtitle: Buddhism in Vietnam
events.headline: Thích Trí Quang Arrested as Military Junta Crushes Buddhist Uprising

events.originalText: World War II: As Axis troops began their invasion of the Soviet Union, the Lithuanian Activist Front started an uprising to liberate Lithuania from Soviet occupation.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Lithuanian Activist Front Uprising Against Soviet Occupation Begins

events.originalText: World War II: German minister of foreign affairs Joachim von Ribbentrop presented a declaration of war to the Soviet ambassador Vladimir Dekanozov in Berlin.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Minister Presents Declaration of War to Soviet Ambassador

events.originalText: Irish Republican Army gunmen assassinated British member of parliament Field Marshal Sir Henry Wilson.
events.subtitle: Irish Republican Army (1922–1969)
events.headline: British MP Field Marshal Sir Henry Wilson Assassinated by IRA Gunmen

events.originalText: King George V and Queen Mary of Teck  were crowned at Westminster Abbey in London.
events.subtitle: George V
events.headline: King George V and Queen Mary Crowned at Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: War of 1812: After learning of a forthcoming American attack, Laura Secord walked 20 mi (32 km) from Queenston, Upper Canada, to warn British lieutenant James FitzGibbon (depicted).
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: Laura Secord Warns British Lieutenant of American Attack

events.originalText: The British warship HMS Leopard pursued and attacked the American frigate USS Chesapeake (pictured) in the belief that the crew of the latter included deserters from the Royal Navy.
events.subtitle: HMS Leopard (1790)
events.headline: HMS Leopard Attacks USS Chesapeake in Naval Encounter

events.originalText: Habsburg troops defeated a larger Ottoman force at the Battle of Sisak in the Kingdom of Croatia, triggering the Long Turkish War.
events.subtitle: Habsburg monarchy
events.headline: Habsburg Troops Defeat Ottoman Force at Battle of Sisak
